mainBoard.flavorText: "All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
mainBoard.name: Ashes to Ashes
mainBoard.originalText: Ashes to Ashes removes two target non-artifact creatures from the game and does 5 damage to you.

rulings.text: If both of the targeted creatures are illegal targets by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it’s countered. It doesn’t deal 5 damage to you.
If one of the targeted creatures is an illegal target by the time Ashes to Ashes resolves, it still exiles the other one and deals 5 damage to you.

mainBoard.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.

foreignData.name: Dunkler Sog
foreignData.text: Für jedes {B} das Du zusätzlich zu den Beschwörungskosten ausgibst, fügt der Dunkle Sog seinem Ziel -das kann sowohl Spieler als auch Kreatur seineinen Schadenspunkt zu. Sodann bekommst Du für jeden so angerichteten Schadenspunkt 1 Lebenspunkt dazu. Du kannst allerdings nicht mehr Lebenspunkte gewinnen als die Kreatur Widerstandskraft bzw. der Spieler Lebenspunkte besitzt.

mainBoard.name: Drain Life
mainBoard.originalText: Drain Life does 1 damage to a single target for each {B} spent in addition to the casting cost. Caster gains 1 life for each damage inflicted. If you drain life from a creature, you cannot gain more life than the creature's current toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

mainBoard.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.

mainBoard.name: El-Hajjâj
mainBoard.originalText: You gain 1 life for every point of damage El-Hajjâj inflicts.
mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

mainBoard.name: Erg Raiders
mainBoard.originalText: If you do not attack with Raiders, they do 2 damage to you at end of turn. Raiders do no damage to you during the turn in which they are summoned.

rulings.text: A creature "comes under your control" if it enters the battlefield under your control or if you gain control of it while it's already on the battlefield.

mainBoard.text: At the beginning of your end step, if this creature didn't attack this turn, it deals 2 damage to you unless it came under your control this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

foreignData.name: Fungusaurus
foreignData.text: Der Fungusaurus erhält am Ende eines Spielzuges, in der er verletzt, aber nicht getötet wurde, eine +1/+1-Marke.

mainBoard.name: Fungusaur
mainBoard.originalText: At the end of any turn during which Fungusaur was damaged but not destroyed, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

mainBoard.text: Whenever this creature is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of the color last chosen. Then choose a random color.

foreignData.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +3/+3 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

mainBoard.name: Giant Growth
mainBoard.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3 until end of turn.
mainBoard.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.
mainBoard.name: Giant Spider
mainBoard.originalText: Does not fly, but can block flying creatures.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

mainBoard.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "There is no calamity greater than lavish desires./ There is no greater guilt than discontentment./ And there is no greater disaster than greed." —*Tao Tê Ching 46*
mainBoard.name: Greed
mainBoard.originalText: {B} Draw an extra card and lose 2 life. Effects that prevent or redirect damage may not be used to counter this loss of life.
mainBoard.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

foreignData.name: Heilbalsam
foreignData.text: Gib Dir oder einem Spieler Deiner Wahl 3 Lebenspunkte, oder verhindere bis zu 3 Schadenspunkte bei einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler.

mainBoard.name: Healing Salve
mainBoard.originalText: Gain 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage from being dealt to a single target.
mainBoard.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

foreignData.name: Hurrikan
foreignData.text: Der Hurrikan fügt allen Spielern und allen fliegenden Kreaturen X Schadenspunkte zu.

mainBoard.name: Hurricane
mainBoard.originalText: All players and flying creatures suffer X damage.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

mainBoard.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

foreignData.name: Jademonolith
foreignData.text: {1}: Du kannst den Schaden, der einer beliebigen Kreatur zugefügt wurde, auf Dich nehmen; allerdings muß es der ganze Schaden sein, nicht nur ein Teil davon. Die Schadensquelle ändert sich dadurch nicht.

mainBoard.name: Jade Monolith
mainBoard.originalText: {1}: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.
mainBoard.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

mainBoard.flavorText: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

mainBoard.flavorText: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.
mainBoard.name: Savannah Lions

foreignData.name: Sengir-Vampir
foreignData.text:
Kann fliegen.
Lege jedes Mal eine +1/+1-Spielmarke auf den Vampir, wenn ein Wesen, dem er in diesem Zug Schaden zugefügt hat, auf dem Friedhof landet.

mainBoard.name: Sengir Vampire
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Vampire gets a +1/+1 counter each time a creature dies during a turn in which Vampire damaged it.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by this creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.

mainBoard.flavorText: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

mainBoard.name: Spirit Link
mainBoard.originalText: For every point of damage target creature does, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers when the enchanted creature deals any damage, not only combat damage.

Unlike the lifelink ability, the ability of Spirit Link is a triggered ability that goes on the stack and may be responded to. Notably, if the enchanted creature deals damage at the same time you’re dealt enough damage to reduce your life total to 0 or less, you’ll lose the game before you can gain any life.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
